Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the approval rating of Congress during April 2009 by stating it was 40 percent when the average of relevant polls was just under 32 percent.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as the average approval rating during April 2009 was below 40 percent, with only two polls reaching 41 percent.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the approval rating of Congress in April 2009 did not reach 40 percent, as indicated by the average of relevant polls.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by incorrectly stating the approval rating of Congress during April 2009.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation could be that the approval rating of Congress during April 2009 was not accurately represented by the average of relevant polls, and there may have been other factors influencing the perception of Congress during that time.
